DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Palliative Limited Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the criteria for enrollment onto a clinical trial with regards to prior palliative limited radiation therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Palliative Limited Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Earlier in time or order._Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition._Cancer therapy using ionizing radiation to < 50% of the body._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Palliative Limited Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.:Cancer therapy using ionizing radiation to < 50% of the body.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.
Cancer therapy using ionizing radiation to < 50% of the body.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has received palli
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received palliative (limited-field) radiation therapy, are all of the following criteria met: repeat imaging demonstrates no new sites of bone metastases; the lesion being considered for palliative radiation is not a target lesion and bowel toxicity is not expected from the target field due to increased risk of perforation.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received palliative (limited-field) radiation therapy, are all of the following criteria met: repeat imaging demonstrates no new sites of bone metastases; the lesion being considered for palliative radiation is not a target lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient received any prior palliative radiation therapy was it completed at least 14 days prior to the start of study drugs and has recovered from any acute adverse effects prior to the start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received palliative (limited field) radiation therapy is permitted, are all of the following criteria are met: palliative radiation must have been completed at least 4 weeks before starting study treatment; repeat imaging demonstrates no new sites of bone metastases; the lesion being considered for palliative radiation is not a target lesion; and patient must have recovered to meet all eligibility criteria?
